summary: I really hated the default elven eye colours so I replaced them with the human ones.
descriptionHtml:
If you are looking for an eye texture replacer I highly recommend this one by nevenbridge
http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=3589

The elven eyes are replaced in that mod with different colours then this mod and in original size only. If you prefer the human sized iris you can simply rename the human colours to the elven ones. Like this:
eyesiceblue.dds rename to eyedarkelfdeepred.dds


[b]Update[/b]
Uploaded a save game of a look-alike character of my character from the screenshot as requested. Clean start in Helgan.
Use the console to change her name or tweak her features. showracemenu
I use ultra smooth for face and body.
http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=140
and
Improved Female Skin Textures
http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=58

Extract to \\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim

Just a simple replacement of the default elven eye colours with human ones. These are my personal favourite colours that my Elder Scrolls characters always use which are:

Dark Elf:
Original red eye with whites
Ice Blue
Blue

High Elf:
Grey (replaces the double blind)
Ice Blue
Blue
Green

Wood Elf
Brown
Ice Blue
Blue
Green

[b]Notice![/b]
A few elven npc\'s have different eyes then those that are in character creation and even with the default eye colours look derpy. Once the toolset comes out I can probably just change the eyes to CC ones on the npc\'s that have this problem.

I would like to have all eye colours available for the elves but I don\'t think adding new eye colours is possible yet, so I just did the colours I personally use.

I included a download of the default eye colours for all races as a source so you can do whatever you want with eye colours.

Original has the original larger Iris and pupil size

Human Sized is exactly that. Human sized iris and pupil.
author: Porcelyn
